Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: Merging Lists using iterators: :I need to merge two lists of strings in java and I'm not too sure on the best way to do it. I have to use iterators and the compareTo() method. For example...Example:   L1: A,B,C,D    L2: B,D,F,G      result: A,B,B,C,D,D,F,GI can assume the input lists are already sorted and i cant use the contains() method. I have some initial checks but the while loop is what im stuck on.public static ListADT<String> merge(ListADT<String> L1,ListADT<String> L2) throws BadListException {ListADT<String> L3 = new ArrayList<String>;if(L1 == null || L2 == null) {    throw new BadListException();}Iterator<String> itr1 = new L1.iterator();Iterator<String> itr2 = new L2.iterator();  if(L1.size() == 0 && L2.size() == 0) {    return L3;}if(L1.size() == 0 && L2.size() != 0) {    for(int i = 0; i < L2.size(); i++) {        return L3.add(L2.get(i));    }}if(L2.size() == 0 && L1.size() != 0) {    for(int i = 0; i < L1.size(); i++) {        return L3.add(L1.get(i));    }}while(itr1.hasNext() || irt2.hasNext()) {    //merge the lists here?}}Any help would be appreciated.
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<String> itr1 = new L1.iterator();
Iterator<String> itr2 = new L2.iterator();
while(itr1.hasNext() || itr2.hasNext()) {
if(itr1.hasNext()) {
L3.add(itr1.next());
}
if(itr2.hasNext()) {
L3.add(itr2.next());
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: To merge two lists using iterators, you can use a while loop to iterate through both lists until one of them is exhausted. In each iteration, you can check if both iterators have next elements, and if so, add the next element from each list to the result list. This will continue until one of the lists is exhausted, at which point the other list will be added to the result in its entirety.
